Package com.lopl.melody.utils.json

Class JsonProperties

java.lang.Object
com.lopl.melody.utils.json.JsonProperties
public class JsonProperties
extends java.lang.Object
This class is the accessor to the properties file. The file is managed here. Change this class only if you want to make changes to the general behaviour of the properties. If you want to add or remove a field in the properties look into the PropertiesData class. If you want to change the way data is handled, look into the JsonPropertiesProvider class.

    If the loaded PropertiesData object has a valid entry of a PropertiesData.secretPropertiesLocation field, The location is parsed here to load values for all secret keys.

  • Field Details

    • data

      private static PropertiesData data

  • Constructor Details

    • JsonProperties

      public JsonProperties()

  • Method Details

    • createSettingsFile

      private static void createSettingsFile()
      This will check if the properties.json file exists. If not a new one is created.

    • storeSettingsFile

      private static void storeSettingsFile​(java.io.File file, PropertiesData data) throws java.io.IOException
      This will generate the json from the passed PropertiesData. The json is then written to the File
      Parameters:
      file - a existing file
      data - the object to create json for the file
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException - if the file can not be written

    • loadSettingsFile

      private static void loadSettingsFile()
      This reads the properties file content as json. The json string is the parsed to a PropertiesData object. This object will update itself and write the updated version to the file. The object is then stored in the static data variable.

    • loadSecretSettingsFile

      private static void loadSecretSettingsFile()
      If the loaded PropertiesData object has a valid entry of a PropertiesData.secretPropertiesLocation field, The location is parsed here to load values for all secret keys.

    • getData

      public static PropertiesData getData()

    • getProperties

      public static JsonPropertiesProvider getProperties()
      Use this to access all the data of the Properties file.

      Example: 

       String botKey = JsonProperties.getProperties().getBotKey();
      Returns:
      a handler object to access al the properties data
